storyInfo: Theresa is defeated, but completes her final mission. For a moment, every Sarkaz senses the thorough dissipation of the myriad souls. The Doctor and Amiya bring everyone out of the Assimilated Universe.

attributes.content: Huff, huff... *cough*...
attributes.name: Dying Infected

attributes.content: You're here again... Amiya.
attributes.name: Dying Infected

attributes.content: Look, miss! I drew you something!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Ha, I can hear you drawing something on the quarantine cabin walls... Amiya.
attributes.name: Dying Infected

attributes.content: But I can't see anymore... I've been blind since yesterday.
attributes.name: Dying Infected

attributes.content: Oh, I know! I'll come in—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Don't. I might just—
attributes.name: Dying Infected

attributes.content: It's alright, Miss. I'm Infected too, remember? Babel's doctors are close, so I'm sure they'll take good care of us.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Miss, give me your hand, and I'll draw it out for you!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The tiny Cautus gently takes the hand of the Infected patient lying on the sickbed into her own—Black crystals cover her entire body, an enchanting Originite sheen circulating inside the crystals.
Amiya knows what this means for an Infected. She has seen it before.
Her finger earnestly traces a shape on the patient's palm.
You said the name you got from your parents is a flower you've never seen.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I went to ask the Doctor and Theresa about it, and they brought me to see the real thing!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Can you feel it, Miss? I'm drawing it on your palm with my finger.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Your name is so pretty!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Um, was my drawing too messy? I can try again...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Little bunny... Aren't you scared of me?
attributes.name: Dying Infected

attributes.content: Huh? Why would I be scared of you?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: We've just recently arrived at Babel, but I'm fond of you, Amiya.
attributes.name: Dying Infected

attributes.content: We're friends, right...? Can you help a friend out? Help me ring a doctor with the bell.
attributes.name: Dying Infected

attributes.content: I'd like them to bring me to see... no, to touch those flowers.
attributes.name: Dying Infected

attributes.content: ...I want to go with you too.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: No can do. You're sick as well, so be good and stay here.
attributes.name: Dying Infected

attributes.content: Then I'll wait for you to come back.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The Infected patient says nothing, and only rubs Amiya's head.
Amiya sees the patient trying her best to bear the pain, and the shiny Originium crystals on her arm.
Amiya, you had just followed the Doctor to Babel then.
I still remember you sat at the door of the quarantine cabin for a long time, persistently refusing to move.
The Doctor found you in silence, and sat down to join you. You only started crying when the Doctor hugged you.
I too, wanted to hold you in my arms, but I couldn't bear to disturb you both.
Amiya... you're a bright child. You knew that Infected would never return.
She didn't want you to see her leave. It would be too cruel for a child to witness. But she didn't know just how strong you are.
I see many things from your gentle eyes. You want to help them...
No matter their race or Infection status—you see them all as lively, lovely people.
It was from that moment I began to harbor a selfish idea—
Perhaps... you could bear this crown in the future...
Perhaps... you can go further than I have.
I was in no hurry to hand over a responsibility this heavy to you. I thought I had the luxury of time to be by your side as you grew up—
I'm sorry, Amiya. I broke my promise.

attributes.options: ...The Arts that trapped us in there is gone.

attributes.content: Theresa's aura... is fading away.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Doctor, Dr. Kal'tsit... is it over?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Is it... all over?
But... what about 'Amnannam'?

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Doctor... I didn't find any leads to the primordial Originium from Theresa.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: We were one step too late.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: 'Amnannam' is no longer here...;The first Originium has been sent away.

attributes.content: So you've noticed, Doctor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Can you still see the top of the spire now?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Dr. Kal'tsit, aren't we standing on...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: ...Those huge white pillars are still extending downwards...;I can no longer see where they end...

attributes.content: I'm afraid the dust isn't going to settle so easily.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Wait...;Where's W?

attributes.content: These threads are such an eyesore—
There she is!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Bunny! Help me out!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Everyone's saying she's gone, but I have to see it for myself.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Pink-white threads fork out like branches, attaching and growing on the white pillars.
They land on the red roots, wrapping, twisting...
Eventually covering this tower of infinity completely.
Amiya, I'm not going to regret like I did back then again.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: At the very least, I hope this time...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The same goes for us.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Amiya walks to the silk-wrapped roots, gently touching the soft matter.
Sparks of flame drop from the hem of her skirt, leaving clusters of fire in her path.
The flames under her do not extinguish easily, but spread to the threads.
They continue to climb, replacing the fractured white threads as they wrap around the only tower standing between land and sky.
Threads flutter and fall to the floor.
They quickly cover the roots, like a garden in bloom by wind, with flames burning within.
Theresa sits among the flower-like flames, leaning on the roots as she looks at the golden ocean in the 'sky' coming to a calm.
Amiya, you're so much stronger than I imagined. How warm these flames are...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: 'Flames that burn away all decay', you've really done it, Amiya.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Well, since that's done, come over. Closer.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa, we—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Ssh... I know what you're thinking in that little mind of yours.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Look at the ocean above our heads. The waves we made are calming down. Soon we'll leave.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Amiya. Some wishes shouldn't be voiced out loud, because they'll only leave more sorrow behind.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: No, Theresa. I don't want to leave any more regrets. I wish... we all wish you can stay.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Even if I'll let you all down again?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Isn't it more important to have the people I care about know how I feel? That's what the Doctor taught me.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: *smiles* You've truly grown up, Amiya.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...I'll always be with you, Amiya. As I promised you...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Originium no longer contains the slightest bit of my own information, but I'm sure you won't abandon the ideals I once hoped for.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Is there no other way to let you stay—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: To save me, and end this war?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: There is no one on this land that will manage to realize every single wish. That includes even the creator.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Amiya, do not lament over the dead. Exercise more concern for the living, especially those who scoff at the notion of hope.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But for now, before we leave... let's quietly—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Your Highness! Sorry, I-I just, couldn't keep it in anymore.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Oh... W? Is this a hug from you?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Your Highness...? Your eyes...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I can't see clearly anymore. The information flow holding this body together is fading away.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But I still have my sense of touch. And I can tell you're not crying. That's good.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa reaches out and returns the embrace, gently patting W's shoulder.
Your Highness, y-you don't mind...?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Why would I?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Hm... I suppose worrying about that isn't anything strange coming from you. You haven't changed one bit, W.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I can still remember our time back at Babel, when you were hiding in a corner with your camera in hand, hesitating to come forward...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...Y-You saw me?!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Of course. Actually, I was even waiting for you to come over for a photo together. But you never did manage to muster up the courage.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Your Highness?! You saw—and even remembered that?!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: E-Even—
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Taking a cheeky picture of me? Not just that. I didn't think the reckless mercenary from back then would grow into the woman before me today.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The truth of how the Chernobog and Lungmen conflicts were actually settled, the mercenary group giving Manfred headaches for the past few years, and of course, your appearance in this place that shouldn't have happened at all...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You can achieve so much more than you imagine, W.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You should have realized by now I'm not so divine as you believe, and you're not insignificant.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Haha... Hahaha! I don't care if you're consoling me, or deceiving me—I'm taking it to heart!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Your Highness, you really are always so... gentle. When we first arrived in this damn place, when I saw you, I was so afraid—
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I want to make up for that missed photo opportunity, Your Highness!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Camera, camera... wait, when did it break—That damn Qalid'čoa!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I'm afraid it wouldn't work here, even if it wasn't broken.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: W, I know you don't want to leave any regrets. I am the same.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I don't want to leave you thinking I break my promises.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Wha?!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I still owe you a name, remember?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: 'W' belongs to a departed Sarkaz, and a cycle that should have ended...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: As I said, you deserve a more fitting name. A proper name for a Sarkaz woman like yourself.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Well, I did want to wait until the dust settled in Kazdel first, but I'm afraid I won't get to see that day come.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Wait, Your Highness! Hold on, I, I... still don't get...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Give me some time! Wait, no! I should be writing this down!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Screw it, I don't care anymore! I'm ready!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: 'Wiš'adel'.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...Will that be hard to remember?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: How could it be?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: 'Wiš'a', and 'del', right? Del means home, that I know. But Wi... wiš'a...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: It means to 'Wish'.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: To wish... for a home.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Yes. Kazdel's destiny—could you witness it, in my stead?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But... I... you... Theresis...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Kazdel's future is in your hands. Not mine, nor Theresis's.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You'll understand when the day comes.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Haha... Alright! Wiš'adel... Wiš'a—del...
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: It's engraved onto my brain forever. I'll never forget it!
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: I like it. Sounds so much better than the names Hoederer threw at me from his dictionary.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Kal'tsit, Amiya, and you in the hood. Heard that? Call me Wiš'adel from now on. And you'd better not get it wrong.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Also, I just decided to head down to the Military Commission later and bomb my name out with explosives. That way, nobody'll ever forget it.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Or maybe the roof's better. I want the flames to spread so far you can even see it from Londinium...
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Wiš'a...del.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I know what you want to say. I'm not crying.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: I'm shaking because... hehe... hah...
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: *ahem* Why's everyone all quiet now?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: You.. I... can't find the words to say...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Go, Amiya.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Before she vanishes completely... she'll be happy with you by her side.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Even if she'll never admit it herself.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Doctor, we may be standing against Theresa now, but I have to admit she has achieved something beyond the limits of my imagination.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I believe you as you are right now, should already have some conjectures in mind even if you're missing your past memories.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: It has something to do with that mysterious person.;...Priestess...

attributes.content: Theresa, our mission is far from being over, yes?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Have you already handed the first Originium to him?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Theresa, this difficult problem you're leaving us with is truly—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit, things don't always go the way we want. All we have done is to do what we should, nothing more.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Doctor, your appearance before me right now is proof I've won our earlier bet.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.options: Theresa...;You still hide so many secrets.

attributes.content: Hah. Doctor, allow me to instill a little bit more suspense.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You're still not ready, even now, even if all of you've surpassed me—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: See the ocean waves billowing?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We don't have much time left.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I always knew our reunion only meant another parting.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: My dear Kal'tsit, since we're all clear about our respective endings, why should we go through sorrow yet again?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Can you come closer?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa stretches out her hand and touches the ends of Kal'tsit's hair.
Ah, here you are. I hope my staunch and strong Kal'tsit isn't shedding any tears this time either.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You're always like this.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'm a very fortunate soul, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Every time I leave, I do so with my dearest friend by my side...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa... she's disappearing...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: She's what? Bunny, what kinda nonsense is that? Isn't Her Highness with us right now? I'm even hugging—
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Wiš'adel, haven't you achieved what you wanted to do...?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You met, defeated me, and finally, killed me.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It's time to let go.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I will leave without a trace, and no longer exist anywhere you can see.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa, do you mean that the Originium will no longer bear any traces of you?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Yes, I won't allow Originium to become our cage.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: All that I've strived for, is just to free the Sarkaz completely.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Sarkaz should be free, in both life and death.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: 'Destroy something, to create a ladder...' Even if what I end up destroying is myself.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.options: You're so... different from the Theresa I had in mind.

attributes.content: Dr. {@nickname}... This is our 'first' meeting, isn't it?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What bits have you heard of me... what kind of Theresa do you have in your mind?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: A founder of Babel, a faultless idealist?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Or a cold, calculated King of Sarkaz, a schemer who instigates war?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.options: No, neither.
Both are roles that others need you to play.

attributes.content: Is that so...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I didn't think we'd get the chance to say our farewells so peacefully.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.options: This is...?;I've never been here before.

attributes.content: A friend bid farewell to me here, a long time ago.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I witnessed my friend's death, and from here I began walking towards my own.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...I like this place.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But it is also somewhere I cannot reach or visit, ever.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It only perpetually exists in the memories of the void, unreachable throughout my whole life.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Dr. {@nickname}, what kind of person do I seem to you right now—?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.options: Someone who would do everything and anything for the fate of their people.;Someone always chasing after a lofty ideal.;I... don't know.

attributes.content: Is that so? Quite the interesting answer.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You and me, past and present, what is gone, and what is to come...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Time seems to hold no meaning here. Perhaps we have already said something similar at some other point in time.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But what you say isn't completely baseless.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I was once warned about my future, but I was clear this was my path to tread.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I wouldn't give up, no matter if I lived or died, regardless of place and time.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: However, the very same words coming from you hold no irony at all.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Thank you, Doctor.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What defines a lofty ideal? Who ought to define it?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I exacted violence on other races for Sarkaz freedom. I renounced the belief I once defended with my life, and stood against all of you...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Rhodes Island of today has already stepped out of Babel's shadow...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Though it has abandoned some concepts Babel once adhered to, for the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You fly peace as your banner, but employ violence to help our oppressors bring back suffering to the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But at the same time, I can't deny your own lofty ideals, just like how I can't deny my past self.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Perhaps you believe you completely comprehend what 'lofty' means... but for me, the phrase still weighs too heavy.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: However, thank you, Doctor.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I can sense you're not lying right now.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But if you're still going to give a perfunctory reply at such a moment... my disappointment will only grow.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Of course, a little loss isn't surprising at all. I really want to know your answer, Doctor.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Doctor, don't give up on finding the answer. If you're still just following Rhodes Island's ideals as you go—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I worry if you're ready enough to handle whatever it is that you encounter in the future.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Just keep going, like how I hoped you would in the past.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.options: ...To be honest, I can't give you a proper evaluation.;You're still a conundrum to me.

attributes.content: You're cautious, still hostile and wary toward me just like you were back then... of course, we stand now on opposing sides like we did before.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But no matter. You merely haven't had enough time to figure out each and every single enigma there is.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: A pity we always have our chats when the clock is ticking down so fast.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.options: I heard so many stories about you on Rhodes Island.
You've done so much.;You still have many regrets.

attributes.content: My mission is over.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Many years ago, you and Kal'tsit pushed a door opened for me, to a wider world.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But I was already a sovereign to the Sarkaz. I bear their suffering, their fate.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: My ideals and vision may transcend that sky of nothingness, but the weight of reality still pulled me back down to earth.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I was already convinced back then that the person who could change the Sarkaz, or even the future of Terra itself was absolutely not me—it has never been me.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: A close friend whom I trust the most already predicted this end.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.options: And that person... is me—?

attributes.content: Doctor, give me your hand.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Yes, I had the fortune to meet your 'truest' self.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: That person was wise, gentle.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Though bearing with the heaviest of duty and wearing the strongest of shackles, that one never gave up hope, ever.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I'm gratified.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You stand alongside Kal'tsit and Amiya now, and so I believe I made the right choice back then.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The choices we made on our own have also determined the path to where we are now.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Our original meeting in haste was just like this parting between two strangers... was it not?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.options: I can't sense any... resentment from you.

attributes.content: Resentment? Why?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: To this day, I still feel only regret and a longing from when I touched the depths on your soul and the unimaginable truth.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Yes... it is because I touched the depths of your heart that I hold so much regret... we lost a chance to walk on the same path.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Perhaps that person was so fascinating due to an internal conflict no one else can empathize with.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.options: ...Just what kind of person was 'I'?;...Speculations, questions—I can't piece together fully what 'I' was.;All this contradictory information is making me feel confused and anxious.

attributes.content: Haven't you noticed? You don't doubt your decisions now.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What shapes your true self? Everything that you've experienced, or your already concealed past?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Look at where we are, Doctor.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Those silent memories and the truth of everything, are they not by your side...?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.options: Originium...

attributes.content: Past, present, future. Time is no longer defined by the rules we find so familiar at the end of Originium.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You no longer remember...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But you told me once, that 'Originium'—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Brought an innumerable amount of suffering upon this land, along with countless possibilities. Created by hundreds of millions of sacrifices in the era you came from.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: When you created Originium, what expectations did you harbor towards it and this land?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Look, at everything recorded inside this golden ocean... do they line up with your expectations?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You see it...
Ursus's inferno, Kjerag's wind and snow, Iberia's tides...
A torrent of information rushes past you, in units of civilizations, from time and space since time immemorial.
You suddenly realize—

attributes.options: All the questions I have...;All the past I forgot...
Can be answered and found in this field of Originium.

attributes.content: You retract your hands.

attributes.options: It is all that I've gone through that shapes what I am today.
And not my concealed past.

attributes.content: You always have a pleasant surprise in store...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Doctor... we managed to meet once more while I lie deep in the sea of information after our parting.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It is my past, but it is your future.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Though you might still be on a path to find yourself, you still want to prove to me that you're—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: 'Just as I always have been.'
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: How I wish I could see you find the answers with my own eyes. But I'm sorry... I can't go any further.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Doctor, I have to go, and so do you all...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: If you have no intention of being trapped in this infinite nothingness for all eternity, that is.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Goodbye, Dr. {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: My dear friend whom I've never met.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.options: —Theresa!

attributes.content: There is no response.
The white figure atop the tower has vanished.
Nothing remains.
Theresa... She's gone.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Doctor, what did you see?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Theresa... told me...
What kind of person she was.;What kind of person I am.
I found it... where 'Amnannam' is.

attributes.content: We'll leave this place.
The waves of information have subsided.
Do you hear the voices of the myriad souls departing, Banshee—
The tower is at peace, Your Highness...
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The waves are flowing backwards into a hell we cannot comprehend.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The flames that could burn even these roots have no way to light up the infinite night.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Where will all of you go from here?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: An eternal void, a true death.
We will no longer stay on the other side, Aefanyl.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: 'Logos'. You should get more used to being called by this name.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You've made your choice, the choice of a Rhodes Island elite operator.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Logos stands on the endless flow of information, his own figure leaving its mark on the vast ocean.
The slender figure on the other side stands in silence.
Ripples cause her silhouette to waver, no longer clear.
When I heard you sound the knell for yourself by the river, I was already waiting for an old friend to appear on this side.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: *sigh* A pity Laqeramaline is still unwilling to involve herself in this war.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Mother... she did indeed rescue me from death.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: With an ingenious method, but one befitting her former character.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: She has also made her choice, as you have.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I saw you confronting the myriad souls, no less impressive than the time your mother and I stood side by side in battle.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I'll have no way of seeing her again. Say farewell to her for me, Logos.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Your Highness, your figure is fading—
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Departure is also a form of resistance. This is what we've chosen for ourselves.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Originium shall not cage us here for eternity.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I... don't understand. Where did the cage come from, and what do you seek for?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: There's no need to comprehend it, Logos.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You need only know the trapped myriad souls are now dissipating into freedom via a complicated flow of information impossible to parse.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: No longer readable, recordable—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: 'A true death'.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: All kings and heroes will no longer respond to my words, and no longer will anyone be on the other side...
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Your Highness, will the myriad souls still exist after today?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Will there be ferrymen with an array on torches lighting up the other side?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: No more.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Then where will our kin go, when they leave us?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I don't know... I'm afraid it's too late for me to find that answer.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I've walked to the end, and the truth of civilization lies before me in fog. There is no way for me to touch it, but it does not mean the rest of you cannot cross it.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Your Highness...?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: *chuckle* I've just unloaded the burden of worrying for the future. What the myriad souls care about is only the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: 'From death comes new life'... you understand the inevitability of fate, but you have yet to clearly perceive the truth of death.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The myriad souls are no longer our shackles, and Originium will no longer be the sin we bear.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Logos, our departure also serves as our liberation.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: No longer will there be prolonged indignant murmuring for a myriad years, nor an unforgettable legacy of suffering to be inherited.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: For the first time we have a future that can be changed.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: 'For the first time we have the right to choose.'
*hiss*... *huff*...
attributes.name: Excited Mercenary

attributes.content: No surrendering here. Only death.
attributes.name: Excited Mercenary

attributes.content: Y-You don't have to kill me...
attributes.name: Crumbling Soldier

attributes.content: Just look at the bloody crystals on my body... ugh... and my comrades... they haven't appeared from the fog...
attributes.name: Crumbling Soldier

attributes.content: I can't live on—I don't want to die—
attributes.name: Crumbling Soldier

attributes.content: Heh.
attributes.name: Excited Mercenary

attributes.content: The mercenary's blade stops right before it makes contact with the dying soldier.
He looks toward the sky, and feels something leaving. The impatience to kill gradually fades away from inside him.
...Gah. Did I imagine that?
attributes.name: Excited Mercenary

attributes.content: *sobs*...
attributes.name: Crumbling Soldier

attributes.content: ...Heh.
attributes.name: Excited Mercenary

attributes.content: 'The Sarkaz will no longer need to live for the shackles of history.'
'We will live simply for survival. Resist against suffering the exact same way as everyone else does on this land.'
No, my ball of yarn!
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Caught you. Careful, Paprika.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Phew! Thanks! Y-You can put me down now, Ines!
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: We'll find a way to rescue Amiya and the rest, so don't panic.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Your life is worth more than these few balls of yarn.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...But my Nana gave them to me before I left home...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Huh...? Wait, did you feel that, Ines?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Feel what?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: A pounding in the depths of your soul.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: I was concentrating on the skeleton. I need to make sure it stays somewhere safe—somewhere no one can locate or affect it.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Paprika, what did it feel like exactly, and will it affect any future plans?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I-I can't say. But... from everyone's faces, it seems like it wasn't just me!
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: You're... crying?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Oh, you're right! But... why?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: 'But what about you?'
'Me? The same as every other Sarkaz.'
'Depart. Dissipate. Die.'
'Please continue accompanying Rhodes Island on their path. There's no need to doubt your decision.'
'Thank you, Logos.'
Your Highness, perhaps you may share my doubts on whether the myriad souls' departure will truly allow us to bid farewell to the past...
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The other side will be bare, but where will the plague of death from this battlefield send the souls of our kin to?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Your Highness, I will witness our end in your stead.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The ferry is no more, so I shall guide the souls.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: If they have nowhere to go, I shall be their boat.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: My voice will set the torches on the other side aflame, and I hereby vow—
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Only when I no longer hear the roaring of my kin on the other side...
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: When our compatriots can rest in peace on this land...
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Will the knell cease to ring.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Ripples form on the golden water as the myriad souls respond.
Kings and heroes, regular spirits or resentful wraiths, they leave with haste.
Traces of the Sarkaz existing within Originium dissipate.
Now... please allow me to send both you and the myriad souls off.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: An elegy sounds from his lips as he readies to walk over the water.
The young Banshee sends the myriad souls off.
(Indistinct Sarkaz language) ...Leave... Patriarch...
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: She is gone.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: (Ancient Sarkaz language) 'Amnannam' has bloomed, destiny already in our hands.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: She honored her vow, so the war will also abide by her.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Go, no longer shroud yourself with the fog. Water death with death, and honor departure with victory.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Victoria's condolences... I shall personally receive it in her stead.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The blue fowlbeast pecks at the tears of the white-horned demon.
She caresses the fowlbeast's feathers on its brow—Can Nightingale's inherently empty soul feel the pain of that departure?
Liz... did you feel that?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: The throbbing in our souls, lamenting whispers echoing in our minds.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: The corners of Liz's eyes twitch minutely, unable to respond in her deep slumber.
Shining, is her condition worsening?
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: No, she'll be fine.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Margaret, we have to meet with the Doctor and the others with haste.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: ...Is it because of that thing transforming in the sky earlier?
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: When it began changing, you started acting strange.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Is this another Confessarius conspiracy too?
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: No... at the very least, he will be unable to involve himself in this matter for the time being.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Though it definitely has a link to his schemes.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Every Sarkaz has probably felt it—the departure of someone extremely important to us all.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Hm... I can't fully comprehend what exactly you're talking about, but any new accidents in our current situation might affect how the war will go.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: You're right, the Doctor and the rest should have more pivotal information on their end.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: There's no more time to waste, let's go.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: General, General!
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: This place is...
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: We were cleaning up the battlefield when we so fortunately found you...
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: General... we failed to recapture the 'Lifebone'.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Am I the only one here?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Ascalon...
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: General, your wounds...
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: We'll bring you back to camp for treatment right now.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: We missed our chance, and time is no longer on our side. Our top priority now is to return to Londinium and discuss our next move of our plan with the Regent.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Contact the spy sentries ahead to cooperate with us, and prepare to cross this warzone.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: General! Look at the blood dripping nonstop... you're in terrible shape! The Military Commission can't afford to lose another high-ranking officer!
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: I gave an order.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: ...This is for the remaining, living Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Yes... sir.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: What happened...?
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: ...Impossible. This feeling—
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Your Highness, is this the price you spoke of...?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: For the Sarkaz's future...
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: From today onwards, there will be no trace of your existence anywhere, even within Originium...
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The 'gods', or the arrogant being professing to be the creator...
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Will you see them at the end of your path... Theresa?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: After I felt you brushing past me, your voice has turned harder to hear.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: All I hear now from the void surrounding me is muffled, vapid noise.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The path ahead is clear, and it's time for everything to end.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Theresa—
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: 'Can you still hear my voice...?'
I can.
Yours, the newborns, and the dying ones... here, we can hear the voice of every Sarkaz...
The souls are stranded in an ocean of unconsciousness, shouting our names before they drown as they await guidance.
In a present no longer recorded anywhere in time, the name we respond to the most... is 'Theresa'.
I can hear the raging rumbling from skeletons that fell from the sea of stars into the ice field ten thousand years ago. Unknown, dreadful, terrifying.
We have ended the oppression that was branded into our blood from that time onward... No, we have yet to do so.
We questioned ourselves: Did our resistance hold any meaning then?
...The future will prove it to us.
Then, what about now?
Now we shall go far, far away.
That is my reply.
The myriad souls who never gave up resisting until they completely dissipated, did one last thing for the Sarkaz within the Originium—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: They fought for a future where everyone has a right to survive, for the ones still alive.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Onward, everyone.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: That day, a certain exhausted Sarkaz girl fell into a deep sleep within the warm flames of the Kazdel Soul Furnace for some reason.
She dreamed of her mother far away in a foreign country, standing in light within the pitch-black darkness speaking to her.
She couldn't hear her clearly, but she did not cry either. Because she saw her mother smile. Then, she woke up, opened her eyes, and saw a pure white flower in full bloom by her head.
The black dust from the forge burning death landed on the fragile flower petals, but it unexpectedly highlighted the flower's dazzling vitality even more instead.
Here, death and light congregate. The girl shed tears at the beauty created by setting death aflame.
After that day, Sarkaz passing by the Soul Furnace would see a girl show up every single day to water a flower growing in the Originium dust and bones with drops of dew.
She offered tribute to the light until the day that flower withered and died.

attributes.text: 'Is that how the story ends...? Why is it so sad, Theresa?'
'Sad? I actually see it as a happy tale of hope arriving, Amiya.'
'The flower withered, returned to dust. But the seed of new life has already been sown.'

attributes.content: ...Did the revenant get left behind?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: No, the myriad souls never took in revenants.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Even if he regather his thoughts, his intrinsically Originium-influenced self cannot be reversed or changed.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: So he was never to depart with the myriad souls.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: So Her Highness never planned to take him away from here either?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: I have no way of knowing.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Heh... so it's not like Her Highness can't lie...
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: I didn't expect you to end up in my hands, old fossil.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: There's no reason to harm him anymore, W.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I told you to call me Wiš'adel!
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Relax, bunny. I'm not going to smash him to bits... I'm just taking him away with me.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: He already died once, so it's not hard to guess why Her Highness let him remain here.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Up 'til her death she always craved for the Sarkaz to unite, so her plan for the revenants is super simple—
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: To first live like people. Well, even if he no longer looks anything like one.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: You don't have to set everything on fire. Your mission ended a long time ago, so leave the rest to more capable people. Like me, for example...
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Bah, just stay in this weapon for the time being, yeah?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.text: 'Do you still remember the story about the puppet, Amiya? He went into a river of tears, and sank to the riverbed...'
'Grief, despair... But it doesn't mean it's a true ending set in stone. You can always continue a story for as long as you want, but what's more important, is the storyteller.'
'The storyteller... are you talking about yourself, Theresa?'
'Me? No... Amiya, I'd prefer the storyteller be you.'

attributes.content: Hold on, do we have go back to where we came from to leave? Is that possible?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: We won't have time. This place is changing faster than I expected.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: So what are you and the crone planning? How the hell are we leaving this place?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.options: I'm still trying to figure that out!

attributes.content: (Takes out explosives)
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Wiš'adel! Calm down!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Doctor, I cannot tell you how to leave this place. The secrets in here are beyond even me.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But I believe Theresa definitely mentioned a piece of key information to you.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: NOW WHAT?!
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Doctor, Dr. Kal'tsit! These roots are breaking apart, and... floating upwards?!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.text: 'Theresa, what if... the puppet was never alone in the first place...? Maybe his companions were waiting for him down there all along!'
'Just like us. Doctor, Dr. Kal'tsit, and you... and everyone in Babel!'
'Little people made of pebbles, white, black, green, red... a whole lot of them!'
'They'll surround the puppet and bring him far away following the fierce river waters—'
'Hm... but where can they go...?'

attributes.content: We are currently 'falling' from this platform.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: 'She'... finally noticed what Theresa has done.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: This tower is being erased. All the information that was organized and put together here is being broken apart.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But I can still feel Theresa's presence here, as if she still exists within the scattered information...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Everywhere, although it's vanishing quickly—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: She's fighting against it... as are the myriad souls.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Get your head moving, hood! Even the platform we're on is breaking apart!
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Shit! The—thing's—falling—down—
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Doctor—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Doctor, I've got you!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Old hag! Your little freak isn't here to help you, so stay still, unless you wanna fall and shatter into a million pieces.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: I have an idea on how to slow down our descent. Old fossil, get out here and help! I know you can do it!
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: I'll wrap everyone up in my Arts too!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: I don't see the landship!;...Where's Logos?

attributes.content: The landship got swept away with the ocean waves when it was coming to a calm.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: But I remain, and I will be your ferry.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I told you, Doctor. We will reunite in peace and tranquility.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.text: 'I got it! I know where the puppet will go, Theresa!'
'The pebble people will take the puppet along the river of tears—'
<color=#000000>'{@nickname}.'</color>
'Even if they get dizzy from the river's current, as long as they don't give up and stay together hand in hand...'
'They'll never get lost within the tears of sadness—'
<color=#000000>'When you are truly confused by everything, you will remember: the answers you seek were here all along.'</color>

attributes.options: ...I think I figured out how to leave.

attributes.content: Theresa, are you the one guiding us? Doctor—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: (Nods)

attributes.content: You and Amiya subconsciously raise your hands at the same time.
Within the silent space, a familiar ship rises from the sea of information.
The airship that was supposedly shattered into pieces is reconstructed anew according to your intentions, hovering below you.
The both of you gaze at the giant diamond shape in the distant void...
Originium. Truth. Priestess. Theresa.
'It's time we left this place.'
The airship accelerates forward, tearing apart the void as it enters the light.

attributes.text: 'The puppet and his friends don't know how much time has passed, but they never give up, even though they're super tired...'
'They share the same wish, and when the water slowed down, they seized the chance to float all the way up. They succeeded, and finally they saw—'
'A sea, a golden sea painted gold by the sun.'
'It turns out they didn't just cross the river of tears, but also a vast ocean they didn't know about behind them.'
'They set foot on land once again.'
<color=#000000>'See you, {@nickname}. I'll be here waiting for you.'</color>
